profiledesc.creation: Finding aid created with EADitor by Amy Miller.

physdesc.extent: 4 boxes + 1 oversize v. + 15 oversize certificates (2.1 linear ft.)

controlaccess.subject: Museum directors New York (State) Buffalo
Voyages and travel
controlaccess.corpname: Western New York Preserving & Mfg. Company (Springville, N.Y.)

accessrestrict.p: Researchers wishing to access this collection must apply for a Scholar Pass and present valid photo ID upon arrival to the library.

bioghist.p: Carlos E. Cummings was born in Springville, N.Y. in 1878, the son of Lowell M. and Kate L. Emmons Cummings. He graduated from the University of Buffalo Medical School in 1903. Associated with the Buffalo Society of Natural Sciences from 1901, Dr. Cummings became the director of the museum in 1934, a position he held until 1948. He married Gertrude H. Voss in 1914; they had two daughters, Virginia L. Cummings and Mrs. Edward W. Braunlich.

scopecontent.p: The collection includes correspondence, 1897-1961; school papers, 1867-1941, mostly from Carlos E. Cummingsâ€™ undergraduate years at Syracuse University, with diplomas of various Emmons and Cummings family members; invitations, programs, and other papers regarding lectures given by Cummings and others at the Buffalo Society of Natural Sciences and elsewhere, 1900-1934; reviews of his book, East is East and West is West, 1941, and biographies from various publications, 1929-1951; travel diaries and other travel papers, 1908-1914; membership cards and papers from various clubs and associations, 1903-1934; certificates and citations, 1870-1964, mostly of Dr. Cummings, but also of his father, Lowell M. Cummings, his wife Gertrude Voss Cummings, and his daughter Virginia L. Cummings. Also, Western New York Preserving & Mfg. Co. stock certificates and transfer, 1881-1896; photographs, including two albums, one devoted to sailing, the other to the Pan-American Exposition exhibit In Darkest Africa, in which Dr. Cummings was involved, and clippings concerning his life and career, 1901-1964.

arrangement.p: Organized into ten series: I. Correspondence, 1897-1961. II. School papers, 1867- 1941. III. Lecture invitations, programs and other papers, 1900-1934. IV. Book reviews and biographies, 1929-1951. V. Travel diaries and other papers, 1908-1914. VI. Clubs and associations, 1903-1934. VII. Certificates and citations, 1877-1964. IX. Photographs, 1901, 1934, and undated. X. Clippings, 1901-1964. Chronological arrangement within series.

userestrict.p: Written permission required to reproduce and/or publish. Information on use and fees may be obtained from the Director of Library and Archives.

did.unittitle: III. Lecture invitations, programs and other papers, 1900-1934
V. Travel diaries and other papers, 1908-1914
